Author: burbank#1598
Content: @ComputerGenie was that 645K or 324K ARRR in holdings (edited)? When it was $.14 that's over $90,000. Wow. Seriously impressive. I was holding over 10K ARRR at DP waiting to sell until I heard that keeping balances at an Exchange isn't a smart idea since that holding wallet isn't yours. Seems obvious to you old pros but the simple rule I just learned was if you don't have the password for the wallet then it isn't yours so don't treat it like it is yours for holding. (And based on all the warnings of these desktop wallets for other coins like SCRIV it seems even then one needs to be careful of malware. Yikes)

`Pirate (ARRR) is a real privacy coin that takes financial privacy very serious` This sentence makes me cringe.
My suggestion would be (happy to hear peoples thoughts or additions):
`Pirate, the privacy coin.` This is simple and to the point. 
Other suggestions could be:
`Pirate (ARRR) is a coin that addresses the issue of financial privacy through the use of anonymous transactions.`
or
`Pirate (ARRR) addresses financial privacy on the blockchain through the use of anonymous transactions.`

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Pirate, the privacy coin. Pirate (ARRR) is a cryptocurrency that solves the issue of financial privacy on the blockchain by forcing anonymous transactions. Using ZK-Snarks, 100% of peer-to-peer transactions are shielded. Meaning, no data from a transaction is given and complete anonymity is retained. Pirate uses a privacy protocol that cannot be compromised by other users network activity. As other privacy coins offer the choice to use regular or shielded addresses, complete anonymity cannot be guaranteed. This privacy compromise is due to data correlation between regular and shielded transactions that can be tracked quite easily. Pirate forces shielded transactions, providing no ability to leak information. In order to 51% attack Pirate, you would have to first 51% attack Bitcoin. Komodo's delayed Proof of Work (dPoW) {link this website: https://komodoplatform.com/security-delayed-proof-of-work-dpow/} protects Pirate's blockchain against double spends and 51% attacks. Simply put, a backup of the ARRR chain is written into a block on the Bitcoin blockchain every 10 minutes and can be restored if needed. An attacker would need to compromise the Bitcoin blockchain to destroy the backups, prior to compromising the ARRR chain. This provides complete security against double spends and hostile takeovers, causing them to be extremely costly and near impossible.
